intro: Gilia minutiflora var. tweedyi, commonly known as Tweedy's gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. This species is often found in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
